api-reference/rb-sys-features.description: The rb-sys crate provides battle-tested Rust bindings for the Ruby C API. It uses the

api-reference/rb-sys-gem-config.title: rb_sys Gem Configuration
api-reference/rb-sys-gem-config.description: The rb_sys gem makes it easy to build native Ruby extensions in Rust. It interoperates with existing Ruby native

api-reference/test-helpers.title: rb-sys-test-helpers
api-reference/test-helpers.description: The rb-sys-test-helpers crate provides utilities for testing Ruby extensions from Rust. It makes it easy to run tests

classes-and-modules.title: Ruby Classes and Modules
classes-and-modules.description: This guide explains how to define and work with Ruby classes and modules from Rust. It covers approaches for creating Ruby objects, defining methods, and organizing code.

community-support.title: Community and Support
community-support.description: The rb-sys project is maintained by the Oxidize Ruby community. We integrate Rust and Ruby to improve extension development.

debugging.title: Debugging & Troubleshooting
debugging.description: This chapter covers techniques for debugging Rust-based Ruby extensions, common error patterns, and approaches to

development-approaches.title: Development Approaches
development-approaches.description: When building Ruby extensions with Rust and rb-sys, you have two main approaches to choose from:

error-handling.title: Error Handling in Rust Ruby Extensions
error-handling.description: This guide covers how to handle errors in Rust and map them to appropriate Ruby exceptions.

examples.title: Examples
examples.description: This page demonstrates the custom components created for the oxidize.rb documentation.

getting-started.title: Prerequisites and Installation
getting-started.description: This guide covers the prerequisites and installation steps for building Ruby extensions with Rust.

hello-rusty-documentation.title: Hello Rusty Documentation
hello-rusty-documentation.description: The Rust code in this gem is a native extension for Ruby. It is compiled into a dynamic library that can be loaded by Ruby.

intro.title: Tutorial Intro
intro.description: Let's discover Docusaurus in less than 5 minutes.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.description: rb-sys helps you build Ruby extensions in Rust.

memory-management.title: Memory Management & Safety
memory-management.description: This guide covers how Ruby's garbage collector interacts with Rust objects and how to prevent memory leaks and segmentation faults in your extensions.

project-setup.title: Project Setup
project-setup.description: This guide shows how to set up and organize a Ruby gem with a Rust extension. It covers project structure and demonstrates how to use Rust libraries in your Ruby code.

quick-start.title: Quick Start - Your First Extension
quick-start.description: This guide covers creating a Ruby gem with a Rust extension using Bundler's built-in Rust support.

testing.title: Testing
testing.description: Testing Ruby extensions written in Rust requires consideration of both the Ruby and Rust sides of your code. This chapter covers best practices and tools for comprehensive testing.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.description: This guide helps you diagnose and fix common issues when developing Ruby extensions with rb-sys.

working-with-ruby-objects.title: Working with Ruby Objects
working-with-ruby-objects.description: When writing Ruby extensions in Rust, one of the most common tasks is converting between Ruby and Rust types. The magnus crate provides a comprehensive set of conversion functions for this purpose.
